alert.note: Alert for Durham; Franklin; Granville; Vance; Wake; Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 7:08PM EST until January 09 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EST THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN DURHAM, FRANKLIN, GRANVILLE, VANCE, WAKE AND WARREN COUNTIES... At 708 PM EST, thunderstorms producing heavy rain earlier this evening resulted in 1-2 inches of rain. Avent Ferry Rd near Trailwood Dr is flooded by 2-3 feet of water and is impassable. Many creeks and stream are near bankful or out of their banks. Flash flooding will continue to pose a threat this evening. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, Henderson, Oxford, Creedmoor, Louisburg, Warrenton, Wake Forest, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Butner, Zebulon, Franklinton, Norlina, Littleton, Kittrell, Bunn, RDU International and Apex. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Durham; Franklin; Granville; Vance; Wake; Warren
